extendedIngredients.name: arugula
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bunch watercress or arugula, thick stems trimmed

extendedIngredients.name: lemon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Meyer or regular lemon, sliced 1/8" thick, seeds removed

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons fresh Meyer or regular lemon juice

extendedIngredients.name: orange
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 blood or Valencia orange, sliced 1/8" thick, seeds removed

recipes.title: Roasted Citrus and Avocado Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Preparation                                                        Preheat oven to 425. Toss orange and lemon slices with 1 tablespoon oil on a rimmed baking sheet; season with salt and pepper. Roast citrus, tossing occasionally, until lightly charred in spots and starting to caramelize, 10-15 minutes. This makes the citrus flavor more complex. Let cool.                                                                Meanwhile, combine onion and lemon juice in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper and let sit 5 minutes (onion will soften a bit and get slightly sweeter and less harsh).                                                                Add roasted citrus to bowl with onion along with arugula and mint. Drizzle remaining 3 tablespoons oil over; season with salt and pepper and toss everything to combine and coat.                                                                Add avocado and very gently toss until lightly dressed (you don't want to crush the avocado).                                                                         Calories 260 - Fat 22 g - Fiber 6 g                            Nutritional analysis provided by                                        Bon Apptit

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425. Toss orange and lemon slices with 1 tablespoon oil on a rimmed baking sheet; season with salt and pepper. Roast citrus, tossing occasionally, until lightly charred in spots and starting to caramelize, 10-15 minutes. This makes the citrus flavor more complex.
Meanwhile, combine onion and lemon juice in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper and let sit 5 minutes (onion will soften a bit and get slightly sweeter and less harsh).
Add roasted citrus to bowl with onion along with arugula and mint.
Drizzle remaining 3 tablespoons oil over; season with salt and pepper and toss everything to combine and coat.
Add avocado and very gently toss until lightly dressed (you don't want to crush the avocado).
